availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel Ammerman (Harrison County, Kentucky, laborer and farmer )

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, laborer and farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Rebecca Ammerman. Married to Elizabeth Ammerman. Father of William Ammerman, Mary Ammerman, and Phillip Ammerman. Laborer in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860. Household owned an additional four enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 142A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 474.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 109B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #15527.
